author: pburba
msg: * STATUS: Nominate a slew of glasser commits at his request.

author: glasser
msg: Experimental branch making it easy to add in-memory caches to various
parts of Subversion, with adjustable parameters.
The APR pool system of memory management is not a natural fit for
in-memory caches.  Several parts of the code implement such caches
(mostly in FSFS), and they all use custom code.  It is not easy to
tweak the parameters of the caches (invalidation strategies, sizes,
This branch will create a cache library in libsvn_subr that makes it
easy to add in-memory caches anywhere that it appears useful in
Subversion and to evaluate the effectiveness of the caches with

author: glasser
msg: Experimental branch to implement operational logging for svnserve.
The main goal of this branch is to get svnserve to produce useful
operational log files.  The full scope of customizable formats,
integration with platform-specific log handlers, etc, would be nice,
but step one is to make something that works reasonably well soon.

author: julianfoad
msg: Allow testing of application exit codes.
This makes all of the lower-level process-running functions in
the exit code, all of the "run_and_verify_*()" functions guess the
expected exit code based on whether or not output on stderr is
expected, and new "run_and_verify_*2()" functions allow the
expected exit code to be provided explicitly.
On platforms without the Popen3 Python class (e.g. Windows), exit
codes are returned as None, and therefore disregarded during
Include exit_code in the returned tuple.

the coresponding run_and_verify_*2 function with that value.  Return

(SVNUnexpectedExitCode): New exception raised when the exit code was not
(verify_exit_code): New, compares expected and actual exit code and raises
an exception if they are different.  Comparison is not performed if
Accept exit code returned from run_*(), replacing those calls with the

Accept exit code returned from the run_*() function calls, and verify
